body_html:
@martinwicke You said this restriction was removed in 1.4 but I still see it.

build_raw_serving_input_receiver_fn is designed to build multiple placeholders for each input (receiving tensors).
ClassificationOutput.as_signature_def still checks for a single receiving tensor.

So to me the restriction is still in place and you can't use ClassificationOutput with build_raw_serving_input_receiver_fn with a saved model.

It seems wrong that these two functions are incompatible.

body:
@martinwicke You said this restriction was removed in 1.4 but I still see it.

build_raw_serving_input_receiver_fn is designed to build multiple placeholders for each input (receiving tensors).
ClassificationOutput.as_signature_def still checks for a single receiving tensor.

So to me the restriction is still in place and you can't use ClassificationOutput with build_raw_serving_input_receiver_fn with a saved model.

It seems wrong that these two functions are incompatible.
